rationale: The agent implements the core functionality correctly in PlainOperationRouting.java by adding validation for non-existing node IDs and throwing ElasticSearchIllegalArgumentException. However, there are several issues: (1) The validation uses `nodes.nodeExists(nodeId)` which checks all nodes, while ground truth uses `nodes.dataNodes().keys().contains(nodeId)` to specifically check data nodes - this is a semantic difference that could allow routing to non-data nodes. (2) Ground truth extracts validation into a reusable `ensureNodeIdExists` method for better code organization, while agent inlines the check. (3) The agent adds an unsolicited comprehensive unit test in RoutingIteratorTests.java (41 lines) that was not requested and duplicates coverage already provided by the integration test. (4) The integration test in SearchPreferenceTests.java is more verbose than ground truth (uses try-catch with fail() instead of expected annotation, adds unnecessary indexing/refresh operations). The error message format differs slightly but is acceptable. Overall, the solution works but has validation logic differences, poor code reuse (no extracted method), and unnecessary test additions.
